doc.after: Yugoslavia entered the war on the Allied side after invasion by the Axis powers on 6 April 1941. Royal Yugoslav Army was thoroughly defeated in less than two weeks and the country was occupied. The Italian-backed Croatian fascist leader Ante PaveliÄ declared the Independent State of Croatia before the invasion was even over. King Peter II and much of the Yugoslavian government had left the country. In United Kingdom, they joined numerous other governments in exile from Nazi-occupied Europe. Beginning with the uprising in Herzegovina in June 1941, there was continuous anti-Axis resistance in Yugoslavia until the end of the war.
